dialogues.text: Sunday family lunch. A noisy, eccentric, bohemian atmosphere. STEPHEN's father, FRANK opens his HOME-MADE WINE. His sister PHILIPPA (17) passes the plates. MARY (2 reads a BOOK.

dialogues.text: And Jane? What are you studying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arts. Languages, poetry. I'm thinking of doing a PhD eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? What in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HAWKINGS, impressed, nod approvingly at STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medieval poetry of the Iberian Peninsula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILIPPA snorts back laughter, whilst the other HAWKINGS stare blankly at JANE for a moment, before silently retur to setting the table. FRANK rescues the mood -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arts. So, what painters do you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I like--Turner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Turner? To me they all look as if they've been left out in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN laughs. JANE shoots him a surprised look, as FRAN pours a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...William Blake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good heavens. Surely not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you try my elderflower wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch it, don't touch it Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter ISOBEL, STEPHEN's mother, with a ROAST CHICKEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As FRANK passes wine, JANE looks nervously at STEPHEN, wh smiles at her. FRANK picks up the CARVING KNIFE and start to SHARPEN it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen doesn't like my homemade wine. Philistine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't watch out I'll send you back with a couple of bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Stephen, you've been to church with a good woman. Are you feeling holier than thou?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positively saintly, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never said why you don't believe in God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A physicist can't allow his calculations to be muddled by a belief in a supernatural creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN smiles, pleased with himself, and his mother and father seem pleased with it too. JANE notices -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds less of an argument against God than against physicists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE 1, STEPHEN O. She eats her food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light or dark? (Re: the chicken) Jane? Light meat or dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er - light, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wing it. As usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old family PUNNING game has begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boooo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How plucky of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh, fowl play! Fowl play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop egging him on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so nicely cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawking laughter. Ha! Ha! JANE is bemused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic, to JANE) Don't worry about them. They're pun mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK is about to place a slice of CHICKEN BREAST on JANE PLATE -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the breast is yet to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK guffaws, as he plates her chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA! Marvelous! Very good. "The breast is yet to come!" Indeed it is! Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! - I'm inviting Jane to be my partner for the May Ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's news to JANE: shocked - but then pleased as he shoot her a quick look and mouths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SMILES and NODS, delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing by his PARENT's CAR, STEPHEN watches (SMITTEN) a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - JANE, in a GORGEOUS GOWN, walks down the path toward hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the blaring strains of WAGNER, the HAWKING car careens across the countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. GONVILLE & CAIUS COLLEGE/MAY BALL - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the GRAND FRONT LAWN of the COLLEGE, a fairy-tale part LIGHTS IN THE TREES, a throng of GOWNED YOUNG WOMEN, and YOUNG MEN IN BLACK TIE and TAILS, all sip CHAMPAGNE on th sequestered CROQUET LAWNS, as if from a by-gone age. A BATHTUB is full of CHAMPAGNE BOTTLES ON ICE. Through this STEPHEN and JANE drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GONVILLE & CAIUS COLLEGE/ MAY BALL - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN and JANE stand and watch the swirling couples on dance-floor, sipping PUNCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAY BALL is now in full and magical swing, as couples float across the lawns before the great facade of the college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we dance, do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no. Happy to observe the phenomenon--but I can't possibly imagine participating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I absolutely agree. I mean, who would want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm quite serious. I don't dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE has a wistful look of disappointment. AWKWARD SILENC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then - A BLUE UV LIGHT comes on. This causes great excitement on the dance-floor. All the other couples "ooh and "ahh" and even more people take to the floor - not so STEPHEN and JANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see how the men's cuffs and shirt-fronts, how they glow more than the dresses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, expectant) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "TIDE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The washing powder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fluorescence in the washing powder is caught by the UV light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When stars are born and when they die, they emit UV radiation. So if we could see the night sky in ultraviolet light, almost all the stars would disappear--and all we'd see would be these spectacular births and deaths. And I reckon-- it would look a little -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE stares at the glowing swirling people with STEPHEN's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch, impressed, as - FIREWORKS are suddenly heard, EXPLODING LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. TERRACE/LAWNS/RIVERBANK - G&C COLLEGE - NIGHT (1   MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) A FIRE-WORK DISPLAY - STEPHEN and JANE watch as SKY- ROCKETS light up the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B) A CAROUSEL - JANE and STEPHEN ride the CAROUSEL. STEPH watches JANE, captivated by her happiness in this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C) A CHAMPAGNE TENT - JANE selects a FLUTE OF CHAMPAGNE a takes a BIG SIP, to the sound of a NEARBY 1920's CHICAGO SWING band. The GATSBY-THEMED BAR-STAFF are dressed in 19 TUXEDOS and FLAPPER-DRESSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why medieval Spanish poetry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE surveys the gay party, sipping her champagne -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I like to time travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what particular time periods do you visit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE takes the CHAMPAGNE STEPHEN has just chosen and pour half of his into her glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Twenties is always fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roaring twenties! Cheers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They CLINK GLASSES and sip their champagne, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So--The 1920's. A good time for poetry was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Seek then/ No learning/ from Starry Men!/ Who follow with Optic Glass/ The Whirling Ways of Stars that Pass."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move off across the NEARBY DANCE-FLOOR, and PASS the JAZZ BAND en route to the LIGHTED FOOT-BRIDGE spanning a river under which LIGHTED PUNTS drift by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - was it a good time for science?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smashing time actually. Spacetime was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacetime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space and Time finally got together. People always thought they were too dissimilar, couldn't possibly work out. But then along comes Einstein, the ultimate match- maker, and decided that space and time, not only had a future, but had been married all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The perfect couple!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the FOOT-BRIDGE, with its view of the BRID OF SIGHS. PUNTS with CATHERINE WHEELS are moored nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE and STEPHEN stop in the middle of the bridge. STEPHE looks up at the STARS, bright, sparkling. JANE does the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's astonishing, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In the beginning was the heaven and the earth, and the earth was without form, and darkness-- darkness was upon the face of the deep."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN, moved, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you dance with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her hand and starts to DANCE with her to the mus and then tilts his head and KISSES her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA pulls back to reveal the couple kissing on the FOOTBRIDGE, the punts floating underneath, the night magi the lovely slow jazz drifting over the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORNING LIGHT on the WILDE FRONT DOOR. JANE, in bathrobe, opens the door to get the MILK. Looks down. PAN down to - BOX of "TIDE" WASHING POWDER. She picks it up - looks aro for STEPHEN - smiles, delighted - IN LOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA and STEPHEN and PHYSICISTS 1,2 and 3 arrive late o the platform. The train is already pulling in. SCIAMA, an the OTHER THREE all run for it. But STEPHEN is making his up the steps, not running - putting on a brave face. When STEPHEN arrives, just in time, the PHYSICISTS 1,2,3, pull STEPHEN on to the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they whistle along, English countryside in the backgro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA studies STEPHEN then returns his attention to his newspaper when he meets his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROGER PENROSE, MATHEMATICIAN, gives a passionate talk before a small audience in a small room. The blackboard i crammed with calculations and diagrams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we know? Let me rephrase that--what do the equations tell us, finally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the blackboard over. A blank board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a simple diagram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles, small laughter from the audience. STEPHEN looks especially relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A star, more than three times the size of our sun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a circle on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...ought to end its life, how? With a collapse, the gravitational forces of the entire mass overcoming the electromagnetic forces of individual atoms, and so collapsing inwards. If the star is massive enough, it will continue this collapse, creating a black hole - where the warping of spacetime is so great that nothing can escape... not even light. It gets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a smaller circle, inside the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smaller, smaller...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An even smaller circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The star, in fact, gets denser as atoms--even subatomic particles-- get literally crushed, smashed into smaller and smaller space. And at its end point what are we left with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A point. A spacetime singularity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN is captivated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With extraordinary properties! Infinite density. Space and time come to a stop. All of the known laws of science--they just stop working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I've just shown is that this happens in every black hole. Its really happening, out there. To real stars--and its happening right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN smiles - seeing his future revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA and his students, returning home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his friends talk excitedly, STEPHEN is silently starin down at the CIRCULATING COFFEE in front of him, into whic he pours CREAM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOWLY, CLOCKWISE - the cream is spread outward by the circulating coffee until it looks like a SPIRAL GALAXY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stares, deep in thought, the SPIRAL of CREAM pulses with LIGHT - he is having an epiphany here - a major insight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then TIME GOES INTO REVERSE. As it does so, the CR CHANGES DIRECTION, goes ANTI-CLOCKWISE now, the SPIRAL on more returning to its original central dollop, and then vanishing. The coffee creamless. STEPHEN looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what would happen--if--I wonder what would happen--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensing his protege is on to something, perhaps even a sm smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. If?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you applied Penrose's theory about black holes to--the entire universe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN excitedly expands on his new idea to a DELIGHTED, SMILING JANE as they WALK side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If--if--so--If--Einstein is right, if--general relativity is correct, then the universe is expanding, yes? -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Alright -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - which means - that--if you reverse time, the universe would get smaller and smaller. So what if--if I reverse the process all the way to see what happened at the beginning of Time itself? The universe, smaller and smaller, denser and denser, hotter and hotter as we approach its birth. Wind back the clock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE grabs his hands and begins to SWIRL him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winding back the clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well keep winding! You've got quite a way to go. Keep winding, Jane! Keep winding...back to the beginning of Time...Keep winding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They SPIN faster and faster until they almost trip and on save themselves by clasping each other closely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...until you get -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN at the blackboard makes a DOT on the blackboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A singularity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacetime singularity. At the beginning of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA stares at him. STEPHEN smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universe born from a black hole exploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going? You mean go further back, Professor? Before the universe began?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going. Develop the mathematics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA takes the KEY for the RUTHERFORD LAB out of the dr and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN writes, inspired, formula on the famous blackboar He stops, thinks, continues, then deletes a bit, and writ again, faster, faster, his mind racing, even as his finge begin to betray him, growing weaker, weaker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swirl of CAMBRIDGE UNIVERSITY life. Dons on bicycles. Purposeful students. Every building looking like a STATEL HOME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN walks quickly and excitedly, with still CHALKY FINGERS, across campus but then suddenly, trips - FALLS - falls hard. His head smashing onto the hard paving stones His GLASSES fly off his face. He is unconscious immediate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS rush to his aid.   MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) X-RAY DEPARTMENT. STEPHEN, his face GRAZED and BRUISED lies on a tilting bed as X-rays are taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B) Blood is taken from his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C) In a PUBLIC WARD, STEPHEN, sitting on the edge of a be in a HOSPITAL SMOCK, turns and looks at a SICK YOUNG MAN the next bed, who looks GRAVELY ILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D) Dexterity Test - Stephen struggles to bring his little finger to meet his thumb. Stephen, lying down, as the doc violently jerks his knee up. Stephen lying prone in foeta postion as a doctor performs a lumbar puncture and extrac fluid from his spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E) STEPHEN lies in the PUBLIC WARD while the SICK YOUNG M in the next bed is discovered DEAD. Nurses rush the SICK YOUNG MAN away, as STEPHEN watches. He is very moved by t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOCTOR is dismissive and unsentimental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called motor neuron disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOCTOR, despite his unsentimental nature, draws a dee breath. This is not the speech he wants to make...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a progressive neurological disorder that destroys the cells in the brain that control essential muscle activity such as speaking, walking--breathing-- swallowing. The signals that muscles must receive in order to move are disrupted, cut off. The result is--gradual muscle decay, a wasting away. Eventually, the ability to control voluntary movement is--lost--entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOCK sets in as STEPHEN watches other patients taking EXERCISE, stretching - walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is--is--is there a cure? Some--? Is--can you--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Improvement should not be expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid average life expectancy is two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN is rocked to the core by this news -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing I can do for you, I'm terribly sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The SENIOR DOCTOR rises to go -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! What about--what about the brain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brain isn't affected. Your thoughts won't change--it's just-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually--no-one will know what they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOCTOR walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION: STEPHEN, devastated. Frozen. People walk past h and he doesn't move, doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATER drips in SLOW MO from an old TAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN lies in a bath, in a TRANCE, knees drawn up, hair wet, not moving, in a STATE OF SHOCK, as he stares at the DRIPPING TAP, until -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - his eyes are drawn to his ARM where he sees a weird PHENOMENON - it's called FASCICULATION - a visible throbb that travels underneath the skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN rushes up the SPIRAL STAIRS, past the "BEDDER" - a woman who looks after the STUDENTS domestic needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he up yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a pounding on his door, and then BRIAN enters STEPHEN's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAGNER is playing INCREDIBLY LOUDLY on an old TAPE-DECK. BRIAN shuts it off and looks at -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - STEPHEN, in the corner, in his pyjamas, his MATRESS now the floor (rather than on the HIGH BUNK as before) legs d up, reading a book of CHESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Welcome--to this week's episode of The Natural World, where we explain the extraordinary hibernation patterns of the rare Cambridge Physicist--seen here in his wonderful plumage..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. BRIAN waits for STEPHEN to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What did they say? Your wrist. What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a disease, Bri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it--venereal, Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Motor neuron disease. Lou Gehrig's Disease. He was a baseball player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motor what? Sorry, I'm lagging behind in my pioneering work on rare automotive and baseball diseases. Come on, let's go to the pub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN tries to pull STEPHEN to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two years to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds strange, doesn't it, when you say it out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I--I don't understand. It's not possible! It's ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were fine a couple of days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve? You're fine. What did they say...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you leave me Brian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, look, I was just being a berk...I'm so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEDDER knocks and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen! Phone for you! It's a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN has no choice. He is badly shaken by the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. OK. So--see you soon, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN does his best to smile. Brian exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE on phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen? Hi. It's me. (CLICK!) Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds the DEAD RECEIVER in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the swirl of UNIVERSITY life comes - JANE WILDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE knocks - gets no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN, huddled against the door, refused to answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE walks past the empty lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full of undergraduates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE enters, looks around for STEPHEN. Can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN, seated with the other YOUNG PHYSICISTS, spots her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE comes up the young men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian--have you seen Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane, have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you saw him. You know he was in hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE nods, as the CAMERA pulls back from the scene, leavi BRIAN (sensitively) to pass the terrible news to JANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE walks in, sees STEPHEN, slumped in an armchair watching TV in the common room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a distance, JANE stops, shocked. He looks woebegone, depressed, physically reduced already. She summons up a cheerful demeanor, however, and advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something educational?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at her) Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is having an affair with Martha. But Martha is in love with Alan. And I think Alan is homosexual by the look of his shirts. I'm trying to work out the mathematical probability of happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some integer of zero, but I'm not there yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just missed him. He was here earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teach me croquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Teach me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you poetry under- graduate types call it..."a slough of despond."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't get up and play a game with me I won't come back here again. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. He finally looks at her. ANGRILY he rises. And walks off ahead of her. She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE AIMS, STRIKES, hits a FEEBLE SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN AIMS, HITS his BALL through the FIRST HOOP, then walks, as best he can, off toward his BALL, using his MAL as a WALKING STICK. With his second shot he hits her BALL then picks up his BALL, places it beside hers so that it touches, puts his foot on his ball, then smacks his BALL with his MALLET, blasting her ball down to the next hoop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He proceeds to play a MASTER GAME that will not allow JAN another shot, enlisting her ball to advance his own from to HOOP, until -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - he knocks his ball and hits the finishing peg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE has been watching all this, her eyes FLOODING WITH TEARS, until she can bear it no longer, and walks up to h and picks up his ball, stopping the game. They stare into each others eyes, until he can bear it no longer and he w off (as best he can) back to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him, then follows determinedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters ANGRILY, SLAMS the door behind him, then tries break a CHAIR by throwing it against the wall - just as J enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN? Let me in. Please. Please let me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to talk about this or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to say-- just...(go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I want. I haven't got time for you. So - if you care about me at all - go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE moves closer and closer to STEPHEN during this whole interchange - almost trapping STEPHEN, who is gallantly trying to resist being taken into her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got two years. I need to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes widen. He can't believe his ears. He looks at he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think--I've fallen in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't speak now. This STUNS him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Strange. Inexplicable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've--you've leapt to--a false conclusion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My chances are probably -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - well, some "integer of zero", but I think we can make a go of this. I want us to be together, for as long as we've got. And if that's not very long then - well, that's just how it is. It will have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't realise what's coming. It'll affect everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She advances, and kisses him on the lips. He is still speechless. She stares into his eyes, with love --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your glasses are always dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes them off, cleans them on her dress. His heart i exploding with joy and hope. She slips his GLASSES gently back on his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. That's better. Isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA is giving a TUTORIAL to FOUR UNDERGRADS -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the solutions to the Schrodinger equation must vanish at the boundary of the box, so we have...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN enters -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time. That's your subject? Any aspect of it, in particular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE is seated, watching FRANK as he ominously shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't realize what lies ahead. His life is going to be very short. So. Be careful. Science is against you. And it's not going to be a fight, Jane. It's going to be a very heavy defeat. For all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know--I know what you all think. That I don't look a terribly strong person. But I love him. And he loves me. We're going to fight this illness--all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER-8 FOOTAGE (MONTAGE) of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - STEPHEN and JANE are married. They pose for their WEDDI PHOTO, STEPHEN in black suit, tie, leaning on a SINGLE WALKING STICK; JANE in white, happy, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - FLOWER PETALS drift down on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. STEPHEN & JANE'S HOUSE, LITTLE ST MARY'S LANE,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER-8 FOOTAGE (MONTAGE) of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a small terrace house - a MINI parked outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER-8 FOOTAGE (MONTAGE) of -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a ONE YEAR-OLD BABY (ROBERT) is set into STEPHEN's arms is delighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN SLIDES ON HIS BACK, down the STAIRS, dressed in a SUIT. He laughs at how ridiculous this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE is there to meet him, to help him to his feet, to straighten his bow-tie. Both look nervous. Tenderly, she touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready. Good luck. Are you sure I can't drive you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN smiles, gently shakes his head. She gives him his WALKING STICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN walks with great difficulty up the hallway, using (for the first time) TWO WALKING STICKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN stops outside SCIAMA's office. Knocks with a stic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA and ROGER PENROSE and an American, KIP THORNE, fac STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN makes his way slowly, laboriously, to stand in fr of the three examiners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his speech has worsened) Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to sit down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thankyou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Chapters One--full of holes and lacks mathematical support. (to KIP THORNE) Professor Thorne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapter Two--not really original-- uses a lot of Roger's ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well at least you run with them. Chapter Three? Too many unanswered questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Four?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. STEPHEN waits, as the PANEL turn the pages of hi thesis. STEPHEN grows WORRIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black hole at the beginning of Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacetime singularity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA and PENROSE and KIP THORNE look at each other. STE can't breath for the tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliant. It's brilliant Stephen. So all that remains to be said is...well done. Or should I say, well done Doctor. And extraordinary theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thankyou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN sighs with RELIEF, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it. Prove...with a single equation, that Time has a beginning. Wouldn't that be nice Professor? One single elegant equation to explain everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It would. It would indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAMPAGNE is OPENED and POURED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A celebrational dinner party, attended by JANE, BRIAN, EL REES, CARTER and two of their GIRLFRIENDS. JANE rises to a TOAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over laughter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Doctor Stephen Hawking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN holds forth on a funny story about him and Stephen, he uncorks a bottle of wine -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's astonishing is that for Stephen and I, "work" was the worst four-letter word, the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen probably averaged, what was it?--an hour a day your entire university career?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable levels of sloth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the conversation turns into a HUBBUB of chatter, STEPH smiling, drops his FORK. JANE, in conversation now with o of the GIRLFRIENDS, picks up the fork without barely look at STEPHEN and put it back in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN watches everybody      talking, eating, drinking, wonderfully, effortlessly      dextrous. FRUSTRATED, ENVI saddened, STEPHEN watches      closely then, before emoti through, rises, grabs his      TWO WALKING STICKS and sta leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone watches him go with concern. It's a painful sigh see how hard it is for him to walk now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he is gone only a few seconds, the guests stop their chatter when they hear a huge THUMP. Several men are abou rise to his aid when JANE signals for everyone to remain their place. Everyone understands and settles again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN tries to pull himself up the stairs by the spokes the balustrade. It takes him many seconds just to get up first stairs but we see his determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DINNER guests are now eating DESSERT, and talking quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN is only halfway up the STAIRS, using his last her energies. Finally, he STOPS, EXHAUSTED. Hearing something looks up -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO YEAR-OLD ROBERT has woken, and stands in his paja at the BABY-GATE at the top of the stairs, looking down a his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time - with his head resting on the step, a with his eyes turning back to look through the balusters the REFLECTION in a DINING ROOM mirror of the dinner part (his POV: tilted at 90 degrees) TEARS fall out of his eye PRIVATE MOMENT of great despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE and STEPHEN sip tea. Holding a cup is extremely difficult for him. A new tension exists between them. She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally - she gets up, goes into the kitchen and then returns with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHEELCHAIR. She sets it before him. He stares at it. Is this his future? Is it an aid, or an enemy? She returns t the kitchen to wash some dishes while he stares at the chair...eventually rising, turning, poising above it, and then falling with a CRASH into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE comes back to his side, realising the momentousness this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This--is--temporary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE comes down the stairs, in her NIGHTIE, dressed for b carrying pillows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MASTER BED now is erected in the little DINING ROOM, STEPHEN is propped up in it, smiling, waiting...(STEPHEN no longer manage the stair-climb.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's convenient for breakfast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts an extra pillow behind him, then they look into other's faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, did you say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said--thankyou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at each other. They kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEW-BORN BABY is put into STEPHEN's LAP for him to hold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NEW BABY'S CRIES carry (from UPSTAIRS) as JANE helps STEPHEN on with his PYJAMA TOP. She struggles to pull it over his head when the BABY's cries grow too urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE runs out to go to the baby, runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN struggles to pull on the PYJAMA himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE HIS PYJAMA. It's dark. STEPHEN, helpless. His eyes are wide open, looking through the grain in the fabric at the OPEN FIRE, burning in the FIREPLACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. He waits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pin points of fire-light through the fabric, SLOWLY MORPH into STARS and a NIGHT SKY. This is what STEPHEN is visualizing. We see what he sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIFE OF THE UNIVERSE IN REVERSE...STARS being pulled back together, toward a single POINT, a SINGULARITY. As t SINGULARITY takes SHAPE, a DARK CIRCLE FORMS AROUND IT, rimmed by a GLOWING CIRCULAR HORIZON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FINALLY - A BLACK HOLE has FORMED. A POINT IN SPACE,

dialogues.speaker: GOBBLING STARS, ILLUMINATED ONLY AT ITS EDGES
dialogues.text: HORIZON) BY AN AMBIENT GLOW - A RING of LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REVERIE ends as JANE eases the PYJAMA down over his head, returning STEPHEN back into the real world. He star at his wife, AWESTRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless, stunned) I've got an idea. I've got an idea Jane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA runs, in great excitement, past KIP THORNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kip! He's done it, Kip! He's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen! He's changed everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA runs on, informing a mopping JANITOR -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Holes aren't black! And they explode!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They explode!!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION: KIP THORNE, confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN is about to present his ideas to the conference. is SURROUNDED by his PEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN nods - nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT A DISTANCE - at a TEA TABLE - excluded, and looking EXHAUSTED after a LONG NIGHT - JANE sits near TWO CLEANER WHITE, and overhears the female gossip about STEPHEN's condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him. It's awful, in't it? He's falling apart at the seams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE reacts, says nothing but bites her lips and frowns indignantly, as the CLEANERS walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE then approaches STEPHEN, nervously. But when he look at her, his EYES are BLAZING WITH LIGHT and passion - thi pulls her out of her SADNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SMILES back at her, as the ENTRY DOORS to the HALL ope and REVEAL a PACKED EXPECTANT ROOM. It's daunting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA PUSHES STEPHEN into the HALL, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - JANE hurries to gather STEPHEN's NOTES, his WATER-BOTTL his BLANKET and her HANDBAG, only just slipping through t CLOSING DOORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before his peers, STEPHEN finishes his address. SCIAMA si with JOHN TAYLOR in the front row. JANE sits toward the B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...allowing us to predict that some particles can in fact escape a black hole. Black holes aren't black at all, but glow with heat radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stony, sceptical faces greet this outrageous idea. As STE continues his speech, ANGLE ON SCIAMA and TAYLOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside, to TAYLOR) He's unifying Relativity--plus Quantum Mechanics and Thermodynamics. For the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head, to SCIAMA) Thermodynamics? Last used to describe the steam engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this exchange (O.S) STEPHEN has been saying:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words--the steady emission of heat energy causes black holes to slowly lose mass, they evaporate, eventually disappearing in a spectacular explosion. So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT THIS LECTURE SCENE (as necessary) with the FOLLO SCENE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN and REES, CARTER and ELLIS discuss STEPHEN's theory

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No,no! What he's saying is--just as a hot body loses heat--right? -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second law of thermodynamics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - that a black hole -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN dips a finger in the FROTH of REES's BEER and draws CIRCLE on the TABLETOP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - thanks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - that if it is losing particles, then, then over time -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - it must eventually disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No applause at all as STEPHEN shuffles his notes. JANE lo nervous. SCIAMA also. The general reaction is guarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First a star vanishes into a black hole, but then the black hole must itself--vanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone!   From nothing--into nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me another beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just told us that - (eating REES's CRISPS) - Time! Had a beginning! He shown us how -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the universe was born and how it will end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIAN crushes the precious bag of crisps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crunch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful! It's racy! It's totally, totally -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The stoney faces of the ACADEMIC AUDIENCE, all silent and unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN on stage - looks at these blank faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE and SCIAMA appear as nervous as JOHN TAYLOR, who ris then to his feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid--this is complete nonsense. It's preposterous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAYLOR drags a fellow colleague to his feet and WALKS OUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it something I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA rises to his feet, to defend STEPHEN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then a BIG VOICE booms out - and stops TAYLOR and co their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP! Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHALATNIKOV makes his way to the STAGE, stopping beside STEPHEN. He addresses the audience gravely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name--is Professor Khalatnikov, from Soviet Academy of Sciences. My field is evolution of the hot universe--the properties of microwave background radiation, and theory of the black holes. To be honest, I came here today expecting to hear a lot of nonsense. I go home disappointed. (pause, points) The little one here, has done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has done it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause finally begins, small, then grows large.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE!- HAS DONE IT! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ya Ya! He has done it! (Shakes Stephen's hand.) He has done it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION JANE: Relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION STEPHEN: the famous grin appearing, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN is swamped by WELL-WISHERS. The AUDITORIUM emptie to the stage, where STEPHEN is SURROUNDED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: JANE, alone suddenly in the AUDITORIUM, trying see STEPHEN, as he is borne out of the room on a tide of fame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN is being pushed by BRIAN over the cobbled streets while REES, CARTER and ELLIS cavort around them. They are a PARTY/CELEBRATORY MOOD, singing as they go. GREAT FUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the base of a large flight of STEPS, the YOUNG PHYSICI all RACE EACH OTHER up the STEPS and disappear. BRIAN is alone with STEPHEN and the WHEELCHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BASTARDS!
