dialogues.text: We can see that the temptation to act further on their feelings is now HUGE for both of them, but they do nothin JANE forces herself to break away, hurries into the next room to be with STEPHEN, the kids and a train set. JONATH is left to deal with his feelings. He sighs, sublimates them, then returns to his domestics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E) BRANCASTER BEACH. SUPER-8 FOOTAGE of their day at the beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN's wheelchair sits on the sand at the water's edge his trousers rolled up, water lapping his naked feet. STE helplessly watches from his wheelchair as JONATHAN engage some playful rough and tumble with ROBERT and LUCY, kicki FOOTBALL back and forth. JANE watches on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN cradles STEPHEN as they sit there and look out t sea, both men carefree and happy, STEPHEN accepting of JONATHAN's care now. They appear as FRIENDS now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHOIR sings a beautiful CAROL. The CAMERA finds JANE singing nervously - the only SINGER NOT LOOKING at JONATH her eyes are glued on her hymn sheet. In DENIAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the Rehearsal, the CHOIR leaves. JANE and JONATHAN clear up the hymn sheets. She passes her pile to him. He his hand on hers. She withdraws her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anything the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him for the first time that evening -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm um--I'm pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. I presumed--stupid really-- that you and Stephen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations are in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it make a difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her by the arm, and leads her out of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is gathered for the CHRISTENING PARTY - STEPHEN, JANE, their PARENTS, ROBERT, LUCY. BRIAN takes PHOTOS of EVERYONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE places the new BABY (TIMOTHY) into STEPHEN's LAP (an carefully holds TIM there as STEPHEN can no longer hold a baby) as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - JONATHAN takes a PHOTO of the MOMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: FRANK HAWKING, scowling at JONATHAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. As the party continues, FRANK sits with STEPHEN. F glances at JONATHAN, who brings drinks for the ladies. He turns to his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always supported you in your choice not to have home help, but now, you need a permanent solution. This--this current 'situation' can't go on. You need a proper live- in nurse immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN glances at JONATHAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't afford--live-in nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't afford to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a way. You need to find a way. For your family's sake. You're world famous -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For black holes--not rock concerts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe it's urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISOBEL HAWKING follows JANE into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know very well what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do have a right to know. We have a right to know, Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose child Timothy is. Stephen's, or Jonathan's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE, turning, wheeling on ISOBEL, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you think of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON JONATHAN, appearing at the door, unseen by the WOMEN. He overhears the following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no way that Timothy could have any other father than Stephen. None. And for the record--I will never leave Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE turns - sees that JONATHAN is standing in the DOORWA JONATHAN exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE chases JONATHAN - stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go. I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's talking. It's -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. What does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there are other things too. I - I - just -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have feelings for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have feelings for you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's - it's difficult for me!    I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no -                    It's so wonderful, for m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. I don't think I    Please, please - CAN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the right thing is for me to just--step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION JANE: Distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: STEPHEN, at the WINDOW, watching this - CONCERN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE does her daily NURSE chores, among these applying ha lotion quickly to STEPHEN's hands - she does this ROUTINELY. (This will contrast, later, with how Elaine applies the hand lotion.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just been invited -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Invited? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geneva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geneva?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students can accompany me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What students?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how much you hate -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how much I hate -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE nods, sensing they are at a crossroads. She looks away, on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fly. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking - that you and the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Me and the children--go on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: could bring the car -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - bring the car -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - meet me in Bayreuth -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bayreuth? How can I manage that? On my own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE looks up at him. Her thoughts racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOTH understand the significance of this. She looks into eyes to establish if he is sure. The look he gives her confirms this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt he would be willing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN motors up the CHURCH AISLE with TWO BOTTLES OF BE in a PAPER BAG at his side going "CLINK,CLINK,CLINK".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN clearing up after a CHOIR PRACTICE turns - stare STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRONT ROW of the PEWS. JONATHAN and STEPHEN, side-by-side stare at the ALTAR. JONATHAN spots the BEER BOTTLES in STEPHEN's LAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is--this okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well--I won't tell if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN opens the TWO BEER BOTTLES, tucks his handkerchi under STEPHEN's chin, and then tips the beer into STEPHEN mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too much--bearing in mind you have to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stare at the ALTAR, aware of the significance this moment. STEPHEN sneaks a glance at JONATHAN. And the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane--needs--help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN sighs deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MALE STUDENT CARER, loads the last of STEPHEN's LUGGAGE into a TAXI. STEPHEN is already in the back of th TAXI with SARAH, a carer. JANE supervises, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And please please remember, 5 milligrams of Riluzole before and after the flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She then goes to STEPHEN's open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you - in Bayreuth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travel safely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses his cheek. The MALE STUDENT and SARAH get in t cab, which DRIVES OFF. JANE smiles and waves till the cab gone. She slowly turns and re-enters her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE, the two youngest CHILDREN and JONATHAN play hide-an seek in the college garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-nine...Fifty. Coming ready or not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE searches for the CHILDREN...she instead sees - throu the undergrowth - MEN's SHOES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises. It's JONATHAN standing there. They look into e other's eyes. What will they do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN drives, ROBERT is in the PASSENGER SEAT. JANE is in the BACK SEAT with LUCY - (TIMOTHY is absent). JANE an JONATHAN make eye-contact via the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the show starts, STEPHEN in his WHEELCHAIR in the AISLE, happy, as we hear the ORCHESTRA tuning. He is flan by SARAH and the MALE STUDENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They erect TWO TENTS. Jane and the kids one, Jonathan the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER - JANE creeps out of the tent in which LUCY and TIM sleeping. There is a third sleeping bag in there - her ow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE then goes to the adjoining tent - JONATHAN's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE PAUSES for a moment, bites her lip, breathless, unab to make herself enter the TENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, JONATHAN unzips his tent and emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LOCK EYES on each other - an incredibly charged attraction between them. He reaches for her HAND. She is shaking. TOGETHER they go into JONATHAN's tent. END ON: t zip being closed again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN coughs a few times as he listens to the PRELUDE o the RING CYCLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS POV of: The DARKENED STAGE, a black void, but for a BURNING RING at its centre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN begins to cough a little harder, then a little harder. The CARER, SARAH, at his side, finally takes note holds a WHITE HANDKERCHIEF up to his MOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SUDDENLY COUGHS BLOOD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN's POV of the THEATRE CEILING as he is stretchered of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE stands in a phonebox, then slams down the PHONE and rushes back to the CAMPSITE in panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VOLVO drives through the night. Takes an exit marked "GENEVA".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN lies quiet and still, his eyes closed. JANE looks down on him. She has GUILTY tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWISS DOCTOR enters, speaks with JANE...Tout en Francais...with ENGLISH SUBTLTLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has pneumonia. He is on a life- support machine. I am not certain how long he will live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know whether my staff should disconnect the ventilator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE switches to ENGLISH -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we try to bring him round from the anaesthetic it is not sure he will survive resuscitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen must live! You have to bring him round from the anaesthetic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is what you want? The only way of weaning him off the ventilator would be to give him a tracheotomy, a hole in the neck, by-passing the throat. He will never speak again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE stares at him - deeply upset but finally manages to SAY -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no question. Stephen must live. I will see he gets everything he needs. I will have him transferred back to Cambridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may not survive the journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE looks pale and weaker than we have ever seen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the tarmac, the two HAWKING children are led toward a FLIGHT (in the far distance) by an AIR-HOSTESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, A small AIR-RESCUE PLANE nearby awaits JANE an STEPHEN. STEPHEN is just then being loaded on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE turns and faces JONATHAN. A private moment. Her LOOK OF SADNESS speaks volumes. He NODS - he KNOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She NODS, SADLY. Her eyes start to well up. His too. It's break-up. Turning to look back to the plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive--safely, yes? Did you get everything in the car? His chair, equipment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She KISSES   him on the cheek and he presses his cheek ag hers. They   both hold onto each other for a moment, know it's their   final embrace, and then she hurries, tearful toward the   WAITING PLANE, leaving him standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE, is gowned for theatre. With an ENGLISH DOCTOR she watches the OP through a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: JANE's POV - of the surgeon picking up a MARKER PEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A SURGEON prepares to perform a TRACHEOTOMY on STEPHEN marking the spot on his neck with the MARKER PEN, and the picks up the SCALPEL...about to make the INCISION...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION JANE: as - she WINCES, then GASPS in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN opens his eyes, looks around him. He is alone. He opens his mouth to speak. We hear only a slow exhale of air, through the off-screen tracheotomy hole. He PANICS, and has to be soothed by a NURSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER. STEPHEN is turned on his side, his back to camera. JANE enters. APPROACHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: Her POV of STEPHEN as she approaches, revealing the side of his face, and then finally, his neck with the TRACHEOTOMY HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't help it. Her hand JUMPS UP to cover her mouth a she gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recuperating in his chair in the sun, staring out of the window at - a BIRD PERCHED which alights a branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN has never looked more depressed. Or alone. There plastic FLANGE over the TRACHEOTOMY HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON the FINGERS of his right hand, resting on the ar of the wheelchair. These, at least, can still move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE moves into STEPHEN's limited POV - holding a CLEAR PLASTIC SCREEN - an E-TRAN "SPELLING" BOARD, on which 6 groups of characters are arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Spelling Board. First, you tell me what letter you want by blinking when I say the colour of the group that contains that letter. Once I know the group, you can choose the character inside that group by blinking again when I go through the colours of each letter in that group. Apparently. Okay? Let's just try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...Green, Yellow, Blue, White, Black, Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blink to choose the group that contains the letter you want? Green? Yellow? Blue? White? Black? Red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JANE's eyes fill with TEARS...STEPHEN just keeps looki at her...then TRIES TO SPEAK. His mouth moves...but nothi nothing ever again! - will ever come out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a heart-breaking moment-- for both of them--and when TEARS appear in his eyes, she can't stop her own TEARS fr falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN gloomily reads a newspaper with the help of a REA FRAME, when -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here. Okay. Promise not to eat her alive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter: ELAINE MASON. She is attractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exit: JANE, touching ELAINE supportively on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then - Professor. How are you? My name is Elaine. I'm going to be your nurse, would you like that? No? Well- we'll work it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - ELAINE goes and gets a CHAIR, taking an interest in her UNTIL -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - ELAINE turns and catches him look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swiftly, STEPHEN turns his eyes back to the NEWSPAPER. EL looks at him a moment longer, surprises to see that STEPH is not unlike any other man in this regard. A faint smile appears. She sits in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE holds the E-TRAN BOARD and writes down a letter, t looks up at STEPHEN - sees through the clear perspex immediately what group he is looking at. She doesn't have call out the colours - knows them. (See her POV of him through the board so we establish the eye-line principle. She is BRILLIANT at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN's eyes FLICK from GROUP to GROUP, no BLINKING goi on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red group--Yellow letter. T. Green group--Black letter. E. Green-- Green. A....T.E.A. Tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good. You want tea. What type of tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. And then she has an IDEA. She PU DOWN THE BOARD. They look at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've memorised the board. Of course you have. What kind of tea? Blink when I say the group that has the letter you want. Green, Yellow, Blue, White, Black, Red...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't got all day. Green-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green group. And the letter in that group? You know their colours, I know you do. Green, Yellow -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He BLINKS. She has MEMORISED the BOARD too -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow? Green,yellow--that's B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breakthrough. They are both EXPERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tea beginning with B? Builder's tea! Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GRINS. She SMILES. She goes to get him some TEA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE, smiling, enters hall (from the LIVING ROOM) and b into JANE, who has just arrived home with GROCERIES. They stop in front of each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's the most brilliant man I've ever met. You're very lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must worship the ground beneath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE can't fail to see how enthralled ELAINE is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's the perfect patient. Looking after him is so much easier than other patients I've had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sooo funny, oh my God. When you read about him people don't tell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) You only do two shifts a week, Elaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN sits in the armchair, propped up by cushions, whi TECHNICIAN bolts the NEW COMPUTER SCREEN onto STEPHEN's WHEELCHAIR. JANE watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy called Walt Woltosz invented the software. Uses a very simple interface that scans through the alphabet and allows each letter to be selected one by one. Using this technique, the Professor can expect to write at about four words per minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE enters -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After initial dismay) Better than one a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I've done is--use components from a telephone answering system actually-- to convert the written text into synthesized speech. The voice sounds a bit robotic, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Shall we give it a try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE and ELAINE hoist STEPHEN into the new chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the future!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TECHNICIAN sets a pressure-sensitive 'clicker' in STEPHEN's hand. The SCREEN suddenly floods with COMPUTER CODE. REFLECTED in the glass is the WIDE-EYED FACE OF STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE and ELAINE sit on the couch together watching -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TECHNICIAN demonstrates - builds a sentence for STEPHEN, selecting one LETTER at a time. STEPHEN is all concentration, observing how it is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set. Then you just click 'PLAY', like this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN looks back at the screen, then CLICKS ONCE. The COMPUTER comes to life and says STEPHEN's first words in months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (electronic voice, strong American accent) My--name--is--Stee--ven--Hawking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN stares at JANE - incredulous. JANE stares back at STEPHEN - horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's American! Oh, my Goodness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there any other voices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all they have at the moment. Is that a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN looks bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a quiet moment, STEPHEN sits alone, trying out the new device. His face shows SADNESS, BLEAKNESS. His eyes move to the COMPUTER SCREEN. His fingers CLICK-CLICK-CLICK on monitor. And finally we hear - his sadly moving homage (t "2001: A Space Odyssey").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daisy. Daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give Me Your Answer Do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally - he SMILES. He has cheered himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN motors through the house, as we hear        -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly my dear, I don't give a damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the OPEN DOORS into the LIVING ROOM we hear TIMOT squealing with joyous delight, then see him run out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As TIM passes out of shot we hear then see STEPHEN slowly motor out of the LIVING ROOM, chasing him, with -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a LARGE BROWN PAPER GROCERY BAG OVER HIS HEAD (TWO EYE- HOLES cut in it, a SMILE DRAWN over the mouth) as STEPHEN voice-synthesizer loudly proclaims the DALEK war-cry from DOCTOR WHO as STEPHEN chases his son around:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-terminate..! Ex-terminate..! Ex-terminate..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE approaches as STEPHEN writes, CLICK,CLICK,CLICK. His eyes turn to her as she hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will write. A Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At four words a minute? About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN clicks. She moves to look at his SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON SCREEN as he selects:     T   I   M   E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him.  MONTAGE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) The HANDS ON A CLOCK turn very quickly, TIME running f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B) STEPHEN motors down the cloisters of his college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the nature of Time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C) His PALSIED RIGHT HAND clicks the CLICKER, as he works home at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it ever come to an end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D)   A PRINTER prints out the text we hear in V/O -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go back in time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E) He works in office at DAMPTP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some day these answers may seem as obvious to us as the earth orbiting the sun, or perhaps as ridiculous as a tower of tortoises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F)   He motors by the college at sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Time, whatever that may be, will tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE opens his LETTERS, and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN works on his book - it's slow laborious work. CLICK, CLICk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE picks up, from the mail, a SEALED COPY of PENTHOUS MAGAZINE (Addressed to: "KIP THORNE c/- PROF.S.HAWKING").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN looks over at her - sees the MAGAZINE, that ELAIN smiling, is starting to UNWRAP. He urgently types a voice message - click, click, click - but he isn't fast enough she has opened it. Too late he clicks "PLAY" -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is for a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course it is. That's what they all say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She surprises him by crossing the room and opening the PA of the MAGAZINE for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to be embarrassed around me, Professor. I know what men are like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SURPRISED, STEPHEN finds himself with the PENTHOUSE open before him. He looks at the MAGAZINE, then at ELAINE, the the MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then - office DOOR OPENS.      Enter, SCIAMA. He sto he sees the MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits, blushing. STEPHEN grins. ELAINE bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SMILES at her - falling in love with her. She detects this, happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN, alone, continues to write, one painstaking word a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE, exhausted, rubbing her eyes as she PROOF-READS STEPHEN's text, like the old days. She pauses, looks up, the next room, at -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - ELAINE laughing at something the grinning STEPHEN has s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE resumes work on STEPHEN's BOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN still working - CLICK, CLICK, CLICK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ponders this. Then has an idea. CLICK, CLICK, CLICK. H inserts "BRIEF" into the title. He stares at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE PAGE is spat out of PRINTER: "A BRIEF HISTORY OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While reading the LAST PAGE manuscript for his book, JANE stops and is stunned by something she reads. She rises, a rushes - with the LAST PAGE - into the next room where -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A PHOTO of STEPHEN and a MARILYN MONROE LOOK-A- LIKE, hangs on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I said - I have long been looking for a model of the universe. I finally found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside the PHOTO, ELAINE finishes SHAVING STEPHEN - then steps away to pick up some HAND LOTION. She inadvertently show him some LEG. STEPHEN notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE laughs, and starts to massage LOTION, almost lovingly, into his HAND. JANE announce her presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine? Can we - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE comes over to JANE, still chuckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind if I spoke with Stephen alone for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not quite finished--can you come back in ten minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REACTION JANE: Slightly ruffled feathers. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE walks in, holding a page from the MANUSCRIPT. STEPHE is 'typing' a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Who are we? Why are we here? If we ever learn this, it would be the ultimate triumph of human reason, for then we would know the mind of God."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'GOD'? Do you really mean this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN types his reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're acknowledging him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he continues to CLICK, feverishly, she excitedly exits, before he can add another word. He tries to genera the next word before she disappears but he is alone again by the time his computer belatedly spits out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sags, frustrated that he was not fast enough to set he straight - but then she comes back in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN decides not to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're actually going to let me have this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN click-click-clicks, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You - are - welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. She kisses him on the cheek, and then as she starts to leave -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - on his SCREEN - STEPHEN selects the message he was writing earlier...clicks "PLAY." We hear -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E-laine has offered to travel with me to A-merica. She will look after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks "STOP".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, sadly. He smiles, sweetly. Both accept what is happening, but sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always used to tell me when an invitation came in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the old grin) A-nother a-ward. What can you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE smiles, warmly. STEPHEN writes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything will be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN writes. She waits. His eyes flick between his screen and her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said - two. We've had so many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look in his eyes is his eloquent reply. Emotion overc JANE. Can this really be how it ends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so sad and bizarre and they both realise it in this moment. She tries to hide her tears by walking away from him and turning her back, hiding her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN watches her, as aware of the enormous significanc this moment as she - then slowly - slowly - motors toward her. He stops just behind her, then nudges her leg, ever gently, with his own lifeless foot, the way a pony will n its familiar rider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks "PLAY" -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be. Happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back, CROUCHES, comes down to his level - right front of him, eye to eye -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As TEARS form in his own eyes, he BLINKS ONCE at her - th only form of communication that feels right in that momen and she understands all that it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles through her tears as she SMOOTHS HIS HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally - words are not needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MOVERS pack STEPHEN's PRIZES and MEDALS, lifting them from the SIDEBOARD, as - JANE watches, hiding her emotion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window is dominated by a single display for STEPHEN's book - A Brief History Of Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The SUNDAY TIMES NEWSPAPER. The BEST-SELLER LIS ECU on: A BRIEF HISTORY OF TIME, at NUMBER 1. Weeks: 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE. JANE and her MOTHER, BERYL, at the dining table, th PAPER spread out before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remarkable. How is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to marry her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blame yourself. We're proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE is touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying hard not to think of this as a failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wasn't a failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it feels like it! It feels like it, Mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it inevitable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERYL doesn't know what to say. Yes it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps too many people were drawn in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will Stephen do next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone back to looking for his Theory Of Everything, his single equation. Well, it'll have to explain human relationships too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERYL ponders this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to have to be a wonderful piece of mathematics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the accidents...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the unexpected forces... attractions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE looks at her mother quickly - "attractions"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistful, dreamy) A attracts B --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And vice versa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then add Time - Adversity -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Adversity over time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - until the situation becomes unstable, heats up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the whole thing starts over. Whole new galaxies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERYL gently grabs JANE's wrist -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling, I think we've cracked it. Shall we phone the Nobel committee now or shall we have another cup of tea first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE, wipes her eyes, smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHURCH in winter - a dusting of snow on everything. T the sound of ORGAN, SINGING CHOIR and CONGREGATION, the f doors open, and the VICAR appears to shake the hands of t first departing church-goers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SERVICE is over. The congregation departs, revealing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - JANE in her seat, still reading a prayer book, as -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - JONATHAN walks up the nave, toward her, chatting with t departing CHORISTERS. It seems that he hasn't noticed JAN and he passes close by, seemingly without seeing her. She averts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly she feels a HAND brush her shoulder. When s turns to look, JONATHAN has walked past, and is still avi talking to the CHORISTERS, heading for the main doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE, with a beating heart, turns forward again and hears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the FRONT DOORS of the church close. She is alone. She starts to cry in the empty church - thinking she has lost forever, but then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- she hears SOFT PIANO MUSIC. She turns. Yes, music is coming from above. She rises, and moves toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE slowly walks TOWARD THE SOUND OF THE PIANO, which sl grows louder, louder, until -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - with a pounding heart, she discovers JONATHAN, at the piano, gently playing his beloved Bach. Only eventually d he raise his eyes and smile at her, a smile which express his hope that she would come to him. She smiles back, her heart ready to burst.  _________________________________________________________

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN, accompanied by ELAINE, motors down the HALLWAY/L TOWARD -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - FANS and PRESS, waiting at the DOORWAY to the AUDITORIU Some FANS, autograph hunters, hold copies of "BRIEF HISTO for STEPHEN to sign. Others just want to take PHOTOS. The general impression? STEPHEN is now a ROCK STAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a MALE FAN gets his PHOTO taken with STEPHEN - a FE FAN (at the head of a sudden queue of FANS bearing copies "BRIEF HISTORY") holds out a PEN to STEPHEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor? Could you please sign a copy for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELAINE, gestures for STEPHEN to give his standard reply. mouse-clicks once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot sign copies of my book-- but if you like--I could drive over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FANS all laugh and all say "YES,YES,YES!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUDIENCE APPLAUSE, continues over - a CU on the blackboar of the word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE: A packed lecture hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: ELAINE, watching from the side of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: SCIAMA and a COLLEAGUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCIAMA now steps forward, to applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thankyou. I first met--the Professor--was it really 1963? Time- -where does it go? Back then, he was kind of annoying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew things that his woeful work ethic should not have allowed him to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's been--really--one of the great joys of my life to watch this man defy every expectation, both scientific and personal. So it's with no small pride that I ask him to return to the stage once more, to continue to do what he has always done - answer your questions. My most irritating student, my esteemed colleague, my good friend--Professor Hawking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As STEPHEN motors onto the stage, to applause -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first pre-selected question, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUEST 1, stands and reads her question from a SLIP OF PAP (All the Questioners will do the same.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How have you been able to deal with all the physical challenges you face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN stares at the AUDIENCE, who wait awkwardly for a reply. It's as if STEPHEN wishes to speak with his own voice, and is struggling to do so. In failure his eyes tu sadly to his screen, and then clicks the pad in his hand. WE HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are some things I cannot do. But. They are mostly the things I don't particularly want to do anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are recognized everywhere, how do you deal with all the attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was stopped recently by a tourist in Cambridge who asked if I was 'the real Stephen Hawking.' I replied that I was not, and said the real one was--much better looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He believed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even bigger LAUGH. APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1979 you talked about the possibility of a theory of everything being discovered before the end of the century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I now predict -- that I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Time Travel possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have experimental evidence that Time Travel is not possible. I gave a party for Time-Travellers but no- one came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER. As GUEST 5 rises and starts to speak, the volum goes down on this question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Hawking, you have said you don't believe in God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON STEPHEN, slipping into a reverie as - he notices the CAP of a YOUNG LADY's PEN falls off the front lecture bench and drops to the floor...(in SLO MO). STEPHEN stare at the fallen CAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: GUEST 5, MUTED, his mouth still moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON STEPHEN gets an idea. He wants to go and pick up that fallen CAP...Miraculously, the muscles in his slackened face start to stir...slowly his distorted expression straightens...his slumped head stirs and moves...his fingers stir...his feet ...his legs...he slowly, slowly straightens in his wheelchair, and not onl this...he even begins to rise painfully out of it, at las standing on his own... Standing, he crosses the floor, picks up the fallen CAP, and holds it out the pretty YOUN LADY. She smiles at him, not at all astonished!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUEST 5 - we can hear him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have said you do not believe in God. Do you have a philosophy of life that helps you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: STEPHEN - back in his chair, as at the start of the scene, heart-breakingly unable to do what he wishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is clear that we are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet orbiting around a very average star in the outer suburb of one among a hundred billion galaxies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: The CAP on the floor, just where it had fallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: STEPHEN, in his chair - then on MEMBERS of the AUDIENCE, being greatly stirred by the following words -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but--ever since the dawn of civilisation, people have craved for an understanding of the underlying order of the world. There ought to be something very special about the boundary conditions of the universe - and what can be more special than that there is no boundary? And there should be no boundary to  human endeavour. We are all different. There is no such thing as a standard or run of the mill human being--but we share the same human spirit. However bad life may seem, there is always something you can do, and succeed at. While there's life, there is hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: ELAINE, clapping - proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: STEPHEN, in his chair, on the stage, sees ELAIN Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: BRIAN and SCIAMA clapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: STEPHEN, surprised by the reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE is studying again, going through her IBERIAN POEMS, JONATHAN walks in with the MAIL, and sets one LETTER in f of her. JANE opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from Stephen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's--he has invited--the children and I--to accompany him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONATHAN reads her card, and then look at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PALACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are BACK in the FIRST SCENE OF THE MOVIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE moves close to STEPHEN. They look at each other in t eyes for the first time in a long while. They finally SMI tenderly, and then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your glasses are always dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN'S POV as - his glasses are removed from his nose JANE, cleaned, and then replaced on his nose. He is moved this old ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HAWKINGS then sit silently, but happily, surrounded b exquisite paintings and furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN and family - JANE, ROBERT (23), LUCY (19) and TIM (10) - roll up past pillars toward a SET OF ORNATE DOORS which open magically to reveal -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEEN ELIZABETH II standing by a distant mantelpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the garden, the HAWKING children play as freely as in their own, while STEPHEN is lifted to the bottom of a set steps by two EQUERRIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left unattended, he motors forward a short distance and s to watch his children. Fulfillment floods into his expression. A moment of deep satisfaction. He then looks around for JANE, finally making his CHAIR turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees her - some distance away. She has detained one of EQUERRIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll leave a card. There's a number you can call. They can install ramps in a day. It really would be helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE hands the EQUERRY a card, and smiles. The EQUERRY no retires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE sees STEPHEN. She walks up to him. Together they wat their children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON STEPHEN: His eyes move from the kids, playing in this paradise, to the screen, where he types something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANE sees he is writing something. She crouches beside hi wheel-chair as the LETTERS FORM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honour. Not bad for an old liberal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you can decline the knighthood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, stops writing, looks at her with warmth, and s at him. She KISSES him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. For today. It's been extraordinary. It's all just been rather extraordinary though, hasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look into each other's eyes, and then starts writing AGAIN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you writing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON SCREEN: as he chooses letters from the streaming alphabet. As each word forms it drops onto the line where he builds this following sentence -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his next click - "PLAY" - we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
